definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
The benevolent sees benevolence, the wise sees wisdom./Different views are admissible. (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 zhe3 jian4 ren2 , zhi4 zhe3 jian4 zhi4

definition: lit. a wise person reflecting a thousand times can still make a mistake (idiom); fig. nobody is infallible
pinyin: zhi4 zhe3 qian1 lu:4 , bi4 you3 yi1 shi1

sentences.english: The pity of it is that an intelligent man appears to have been seduced by the sound of his own voice.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这位智者似乎被自己的声音误导了。

sentences.english: I do not know. Perhaps the answer lies in the star that lit their path.
sentences.chinese: 我不得而知，只能留待引领智者的那星星自己回答。

sentences.english: A wise man is superior to flattery.
sentences.chinese: 一个智者是不会被阿谀奉承所迷惑的。

sentences.english: So, who are these Wise of Tol Eressea?
sentences.chinese: 那么，谁又是那些托尔埃勒西尔的智者？

sentences.english: Plagueis, the wise, was an adept of some of the most arcane and unnatural applications of the Force.
sentences.chinese: 智者普雷格斯熟谙一些最神秘最反常的原力应用。

sentences.english: The wise person does not deprecate life nor does he fear the cessation of life.
sentences.chinese: 智者既不会藐视生命，也不会惧怕死亡。

sentences.english: Think with the wise, but talk with the vulgar.
sentences.chinese: 同智者一起考虑，与俗人一起交谈。

sentences.english: That's Tom , my best friend, Simple living and high thinking.
sentences.chinese: 这就是汤姆，我最好的朋友，一个大隐于市的智者。

sentences.english: There the three wise men present gifts to the Christ child.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，三位智者为基督圣子呈上礼物。

sentences.english: Words are the wise manwouls counters and the foolwouls money.
sentences.chinese: 智者嘴在心里，愚者把它当金钱。

sentences.english: Time ripens all things; no one is born wise.
sentences.chinese: 时间能够完善所有事物，没有人是天生的智者。

sentences.english: A proverb goes, "Better to lose with a wise man than win with a fool."
sentences.chinese: 有一句依地语谚语说得好，“宁输智者，不赢傻子。”

sentences.english: A wise man is never less alone than when alone.
Any fool can create wealth, but only the wise know what to do with it.
sentences.chinese: 愚者亦能创造财富，唯有智者才通晓用财之道。

sentences.english: The same place the wise men did -- in the ordinary.
sentences.chinese: 那我来告诉你，就在智者遇到他的地方。

sentences.english: Many receive advice, only the wise profit by it.
sentences.chinese: 许多人听到忠告，唯智者始能受益。

definition: a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
